page.title: 02Grandmother's childhood.
page.content: {Mark (aged 11) interviews his "Nan" {(Grandmother) about her childhood {during the Second World War (1939- {1945). Mark: What was school like in those days? Nan : Well, we sat on benches in front of long desks which had inkwells set in them. There was a coke-burning stove to heat the classroom. The rooms were lit by oil lamps. Mark: What was it like during the war? Nan : There was food & clothing rationing; no street lights and the cars used only dim lights. Children were evacuated from towns and cities and some people had air-raid shelters in their gardens. Mark: How did you cook your food? Nan : Food was cooked on an open fire.
